Introduction¶

Tellurium is a cross-platform and open source Python based environment that integrates a variety of useful packages for systems biology modeling based on spyder2.

Additional information is available on http://tellurium.analogmachine.org/.

Tellurium screenshot

All code is open source (https://github.com/sys-bio/tellurium). Temporarily there is PyQt4 – GPL licensed code. Licences used include LGPL, Apache 2, MIT, and New BDS.

The Tellurium project is funded from the NIH/NIGMS (GM081070).

Simple Example¶

import tellurium as te
r = te.loada('S1 -> S2; k1*S1; k1 = 0.1; S1 = 10')
r.simulate(0, 10, 100)
r.plot()

Complex Example¶

import tellurium as te
r = te.loada('''
    # A dollar symbol means fix the species concentration
    J1: $S1 -> S2;  k1*S1;
    J2: S2 -> S3;  k2*S2 - k3*S3;
    J3: S3 -> $S4; k4*S3;

    k1 = 0.1; k2 = 0.5; k3 = 0.5; k4 = 0.5;
    S1 = 10;
''')

result = r.simulate (0, 10, 100, ['time', 'S1', 'S2', 'S3', 'J1'])
r.plot(result);
